titleStmt.title: Archaioplutos. Or the riches of elder ages Proouing by manie good and learned authours, that the auncient emperors & kings, were more rich and magnificent, then such as liue in these daies. Heereto is annexed, the honours of the braue Romaine souldiours; with the seauen wonders of the worlde. Written in French by Guil. Thelin, Lord of Gutmont and Morillonuilliers: and truely translated into English.
Archaioplutos. English
titleStmt.author: Telin, Guillaume.
Munday, Anthony, 1553-1633.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by I. C[harlewood] for Richard Smith, and are to be sold at his shop, at the west doore of Paules,

notesStmt.note: A translation, by Anthony Munday, of: Archaioplutos.
Running title: The riches of elder ages.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: his shop, at the west doore of Paules
